analyzed: theḥ apadāna  a vaṭa phala vagga
translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽. The Chapter about Avaṭa-Fruit

analyzed: la bu ja dāya katthera apadāna
translated: The Elder Labujadāyaka
“In the city of Bandhumatī,
I was a monastery worker then;
I saw the dust-free Buddha,
going without faltering.
Taking avaṭa-fruit,🔽I always gave it to the best Buddha;
Standing in the sky,
I received the greatly famous one.
It was a source of wealth for me,
bringing happiness in this very life;
Having given the Buddha fruit,
with a purified mind.
I attained rapture then,
and vast, supreme happiness;
The jewel arose again and again,
when I was reborn here and there.
For ninety-one eons,
the fruit I gave then;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving fruit.
My defilements were burned up,
I live without defilements.
Welcome indeed it was for me,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.
The four analytical insights,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā labujadāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā labujadāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus has the venerable Labujadāyaka recited these verses.
The Story of the Elder Labujadāyaka is finished.
